intro: Connarus tricarpus, commonly known as the three-fruit connarus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, three-lobed fruits that are typically clustered together, giving it its common name. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Connarus tricarpus is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
